topic.title: Creating and Uploading a Glance Image

section.p: This guide will assist you in obtaining, creating, or modifying cloud images for your Image (Glance) repository and uploading them for use.

section.title: How to Curate Your Own Images
section.p: OpenStack has created a guide to show you how to obtain, create, and modify images that will be compatible with your HPE Helion OpenStack cloud:

section.title: Example: Uploading a Cirros Linux Image for Use
section.p: These steps assume you have a user account setup within Keystone that has access to upload images to the Glance repository. Contact your Administrator if you do not have these permissions or if you are unsure.

ol.li: Download the Cirros image from the internet: wget http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.3/cirros-0.3.3-x86_64-disk.img

Upload that file to Glance using the GlanceClient CLI: glance \ --os-username <username> \ --os-password <password> \ --os-tenant-name <project name> \ --os-auth-url <identity endpoint> \ --os-endpoint-type internalURL \ image-create --name cirros-0.3.3-x86_64 \ --container-format bare \ --disk-format qcow2 \ --is-public True \ --file <path to Cirros image file>

section.title: Using Horizon to Upload an Image
section.p: It is possible to use the Horizon UI to create images for use in your cloud. These steps will show you how.
section.note: By default, the HTTP upload option will not work when uploading images. To utilize this option you will need your cloud administrator to enable this option. See Glance Troubleshooting for more details.
